Category.Name: Root
Category.ToolTip: Genie Nano - Device Description File

Category.Name: deviceInformation
Category.ToolTip: Description of the camera

StringReg.Name: DeviceVersion
StringReg.Description: Displays the device version. This tag will also highlight if the firmware is a beta or custom design.

StringReg.Name: deviceManufacturerPartNumber
StringReg.ToolTip: Displays the device manufacturer part number.
StringReg.Description: Displays the device manufacturer part number.

StringReg.Name: DeviceManufacturerInfo
StringReg.Description: This feature provides extended manufacturer information about the device.

StringReg.Name: DeviceFirmwareVersion
StringReg.Description: Displays the currently loaded firmware version number. Firmware files have a unique number and have the .cbf file extension.

StringReg.Name: DeviceID
StringReg.Description: Displays the device’s factory set serial number.

StringReg.Name: DeviceSerialNumber
StringReg.Description: Displays the device’s factory set serial number.

Integer.Name: deviceMacAddress
Integer.Description: Displays the unique MAC (Media Access Control) address of the Device.

Enumeration.Name: deviceAcquisitionType
Enumeration.Description: Displays the Device Acquisition Type of the product.

EnumEntry.Name: Sensor
EnumEntry.ToolTip: The device gets its data directly from a sensor.
EnumEntry.Description: The device gets its data directly from a sensor.

EnumEntry.Name: GigEVision
EnumEntry.Description: GigE Vision

StringReg.Name: DeviceUserID
StringReg.Description: Feature to store a user-programmable identifier of up to 15 characters. The default factory setting is the camera serial number.

Enumeration.Name: UserSetDefault
Enumeration.ToolTip: Specify the camera configuration set to load and make active on camera power-up or reset
Enumeration.Description: Specify the camera configuration set to load and make active on camera power-up or reset. The camera configuration sets are stored in camera non-volatile memory.

EnumEntry.Name: Default
EnumEntry.Description: Select the Factory Setting values as the Power-up Configuration.

EnumEntry.Name: UserSet1
EnumEntry.ToolTip: User defined Configuration saved in the UserSet 1
EnumEntry.Description: Select the user defined configuration UserSet 1 as the Power-up Configuration.

EnumEntry.Name: UserSet2
EnumEntry.ToolTip: User defined Configuration saved in the UserSet 2
EnumEntry.Description: Select the user defined configuration UserSet 2 as the Power-up Configuration.

Enumeration.Name: UserSetDefaultSelector
Enumeration.ToolTip: Specify the camera configuration set to load and make active on camera power-up or reset
Enumeration.Description: Specify the camera configuration set to load and make active on camera power-up or reset. The camera configuration sets are stored in camera non volatile memory.

EnumEntry.Name: Default
EnumEntry.Description: Select the Factory Setting values as the Power-up Configuration.

EnumEntry.Name: UserSet1
EnumEntry.ToolTip: User defined Configuration saved in the UserSet 1
EnumEntry.Description: Select the user defined configuration UserSet 1 as the Power-up Configuration.

EnumEntry.Name: UserSet2
EnumEntry.ToolTip: User defined Configuration saved in the UserSet 2
EnumEntry.Description: Select the user defined configuration UserSet 2 as the Power-up Configuration.

Enumeration.Name: UserSetSelector
Enumeration.Description: Selects the camera configuration set to load feature settings from or save current feature settings to. The Factory set contains default camera feature settings. User camera configuration sets contain feature settings previously saved by the user.

EnumEntry.Name: Default
EnumEntry.Description: Select the default camera feature settings saved by the Factory.

EnumEntry.Name: UserSet1
EnumEntry.Description: Select the User defined Configuration space UserSet1 to save to or load from features settings previously saved by the user.

EnumEntry.Name: UserSet2
EnumEntry.Description: Select the User defined Configuration space UserSet2 to save to or load from features settings previously saved by the user.

Command.Name: UserSetLoad
Command.ToolTip: Load the currently selected user camera configuration set
Command.Description: Loads the camera configuration set, specified by the User Set Selector feature, to the camera and makes it active.

Command.Name: UserSetSave
Command.Description: Saves the current camera configuration to the user set specified by the User Set Selector feature. The user sets are located on the camera in non volatile memory.

EnumEntry.Name: LoadBusyError
EnumEntry.ToolTip: The camera is busy and cannot perform the action

EnumEntry.Name: LoadMemoryError
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Not enough memory to load set

EnumEntry.Name: LoadInvalidSetError
EnumEntry.ToolTip: At least one register could not be restored properly

EnumEntry.Name: LoadResourceManagerError
EnumEntry.ToolTip: An internal error happened related to the resource manager

EnumEntry.Name: SaveBusyError
EnumEntry.ToolTip: The camera is busy and cannot perform the action

EnumEntry.Name: SaveMemoryError
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Camera ran out of memory while saving set

EnumEntry.Name: SaveInvalidSetError
EnumEntry.ToolTip: An invalid user set was requested

EnumEntry.Name: SaveResourceManagerError
EnumEntry.ToolTip: An internal error happened related to the resource manager

Integer.Name: deviceDFNCVersionMajor
Integer.Description: Major revision of Dalsa Feature Naming Convention which was used to create the device's XML.

Integer.Name: deviceDFNCVersionMinor
Integer.Description: Minor revision of Dalsa Feature Naming Convention which was used to create the device's XML.

Integer.Name: DeviceSFNCVersionMajor
Integer.Description: Major Version of the Genicam Standard Features Naming Convention which was used to create the device's XML.

Integer.Name: DeviceSFNCVersionMinor
Integer.Description: Minor Version of the Genicam Standard Features Naming Convention which was used to create the device's XML.

Integer.Name: DeviceSFNCVersionSubMinor
Integer.Description: SubMinor Version of the Genicam Standard Features Naming Convention which was used to create the device's XML.

Command.Name: deviceBIST
Command.Description: Command to perform an internal test which will determine the device status.

Enumeration.Name: deviceBISTStatus
Enumeration.Description: Return the status of the device Built-In Self test. Possible return values are device-specific.

EnumEntry.Name: Passed
EnumEntry.Description: No failure detected

EnumEntry.Name: FirmwareUpdateFailure
EnumEntry.Description: Last firmware update operation failed

EnumEntry.Name: Unexpected_Error
EnumEntry.Description: Switched to recovery mode due to unexpected software error.

Integer.Name: deviceBISTStatusAll
Integer.ToolTip: Device Built-In Self Test Status All
Integer.Description: Return the status of the device Built-In Self Test as a bit field. The meaning for each bit is device-specific.
Integer.DisplayName: Device Built-In Self Test Status All

Command.Name: DeviceReset
Command.Description: Resets the device to its power up state.

Integer.Name: deviceCalibrationDateRaw
Integer.ToolTip: Date when the camera was calibrated
Integer.Description: Date when the camera was calibrated

Enumeration.Name: DeviceTemperatureSelector
Enumeration.ToolTip: Select the source of the temperature to read
Enumeration.Description: Select the source where the temperature is read.

Float.Name: DeviceTemperature
Float.ToolTip: The temperature of the selected source in degrees Celsius
Float.Description: The temperature of the selected source in degrees Celsius

Enumeration.Name: DALSASoftwareCompatibilityComponentList
Enumeration.ToolTip: List of optional supported Dalsa software functions
Enumeration.Description: List the optional Teledyne DALSA software functions that are supported.

EnumEntry.Name: Compatibility1
EnumEntry.Description: Teledyne DALSA Turbo Drive 8-bit (Monochrome or Bayer) requires Sapera-LT 8.01 or greater.

EnumEntry.Name: Compatibility2
EnumEntry.Description: Teledyne DALSA Turbo Drive 10-bit (Monochrome or Bayer) requires Sapera-LT 8.10 or greater.

EnumEntry.Name: Compatibility3
EnumEntry.Description: Teledyne DALSA Turbo Drive 12-bit (Monochrome or Bayer) requires Sapera-LT 8.10 or greater.

EnumEntry.Name: Compatibility4
EnumEntry.Description: Multicast feature support requires a newer version of Sapera-LT than currently installed.

Category.Name: deviceSensorControl
Category.ToolTip: Category related to the sensor functionality and related features

Enumeration.Name: DeviceScanType
Enumeration.Description: Defines the scan type of the device's sensor.

EnumEntry.Name: Areascan
EnumEntry.Description: Device uses an Areascan sensor

Enumeration.Name: sensorColorType
Enumeration.Description: Defines the camera sensor color type.

EnumEntry.Name: Monochrome
EnumEntry.Description: Sensor color type is monochrome.

EnumEntry.Name: CFA_Bayer
EnumEntry.Description: Sensor color type is Bayer Color Filter Array (CFA)

Enumeration.Name: pixelSizeInput
Enumeration.Description: Size of the image input pixels, in bits per pixel.

EnumEntry.Name: Bpp8
EnumEntry.Description: Sensor output data path is 8 bits per pixel .

EnumEntry.Name: Bpp10
EnumEntry.Description: Sensor output data path is 10 bits per pixel.

EnumEntry.Name: Bpp12
EnumEntry.Description: Sensor output data path is 12 bits per pixel.

Integer.Name: SensorWidth
Integer.Description: Defines the sensor width in active pixels

Integer.Name: SensorHeight
Integer.Description: Defines the sensor height in active lines

Boolean.Name: AcquisitionFrameRateEnable
Boolean.ToolTip: Enable or Disable the acquisition frame rate feature
Boolean.Description: When disabled, the camera only operates at its maximum frame rate using the current exposure configuration.

Enumeration.Name: acquisitionFrameRateControlMode
Enumeration.Description: Set the frame control method used in free running mode.

EnumEntry.Name: Programmable
EnumEntry.Description: The camera frame rate is controlled by the AcquisitionFrameRate feature.

EnumEntry.Name: MaximumSpeed
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Runs at the maximum frame rate
EnumEntry.Description: The camera operates at its maximum frame rate using the current exposure (time and delay) configuration.

Float.Name: AcquisitionFrameRate
Float.Description: Specifies the camera internal frame rate, in Hz.

Integer.Name: AcquisitionFrameRateRaw
Integer.Description: Controls the desired frame rate of the camera in .001 Hz.

Enumeration.Name: ExposureMode
Enumeration.ToolTip: Set the camera exposure operation mode.
Enumeration.Description: Sets the operation mode for the camera’s exposure (or electronic shutter).

EnumEntry.Name: Timed
EnumEntry.Description: The exposure duration time is set using the Exposure Time feature and the exposure starts with a FrameStart event.

EnumEntry.Name: TriggerWidth
EnumEntry.Description: Uses the width of the trigger signal pulse to control the exposure duration. Use the Trigger Activation feature to set the polarity of the trigger. The Trigger Width setting is applicable with Trigger Selector = Single Frame Trigger(Start). Note that the Line Inverter feature setting may affect the polarity of the trigger signal and is only available when exposureAlignment = Reset.

Enumeration.Name: exposureAlignment
Enumeration.Description: Exposure Alignment specifies how the exposure is executed in relationship to the sensor capabilities and current frame trigger .

EnumEntry.Name: Synchronous
EnumEntry.Description: Exposure is synchronous to the internal timing of the sensor. The readout is concurrent to the exposure for the fastest possible frame rate. When a valid trigger is received and the ExposureTime is shorter than the readout period, the ExposureStart event is latched in the previous frame’s readout. That is; the ExposureStartEvent is delayed and is initiated when the actual exposure starts such that the exposure ends and readout begins as soon as the previous readout has completed.

Float.Name: exposureDelay
Float.Description: Specifies the delay in microseconds (µs) to apply after the FrameStart event before starting the ExposureStart event.

Float.Name: ExposureTime
Float.Description: Sets the exposure time (in microseconds) when the Exposure Mode feature is set to Timed.

Float.Name: exposureTimeActual
Float.Description: Actual Exposure Time performed by sensor due to its design, based on the requested Exposure Time.

Enumeration.Name: GainSelector
Enumeration.Description: Selects which gain is controlled when adjusting gain features.

EnumEntry.Name: SensorAll
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Apply a gain adjustment within the sensor to the entire image.
EnumEntry.Description: Apply a gain adjustment within the sensor to the entire image. The first half of the gain range is applied in the analog domain and the second half is digital.

EnumEntry.Name: DigitalAll
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Apply a digital gain adjustment to the entire image.
EnumEntry.Description: Apply a digital gain adjustment to the entire image. This independent gain factor is applied to the image after the sensor.

Float.Name: Gain
Float.Description: Sets the selected gain as an amplification factor applied to the image. User adjusts the Gain feature or the GainRaw feature.

Converter.Name: GainConverter
Converter.Description: Sets the selected gain as an amplification factor applied to the image.

Integer.Name: GainRaw
Integer.Description: Raw Gain value that is set in camera

Enumeration.Name: BlackLevelSelector
Enumeration.Description: Selects which Black Level to adjust using the Black Level features.

EnumEntry.Name: AnalogAll
EnumEntry.Description: Sensor Dark Offset

Float.Name: BlackLevel
Float.Description: Controls the black level as an absolute physical value. This represents a DC offset applied to the video signal, in DN (digital number) units. The Black Level Selector feature specifies the channel to adjust.

Integer.Name: BlackLevelRaw
Integer.ToolTip: Raw value of the black level DC offset
Integer.Description: Controls the black level as an absolute physical value.

Category.Name: DigitalIOControl
Category.ToolTip: Category relating to camera Input and Output signals

Enumeration.Name: TriggerSelector
Enumeration.ToolTip: Selects which type of trigger to configure.
Enumeration.Description: Selects which type of trigger to configure with the various Trigger features.

EnumEntry.Name: FrameStart
EnumEntry.Description: Selects a trigger starting the capture of a single frame. Frame size is determined by image format feature “Height”.

EnumEntry.Name: FrameBurstStart
EnumEntry.Description: Selects a trigger to capture multiple frames. The number of frames is specified by the triggerFrameCount feature.

Enumeration.Name: TriggerMode
Enumeration.Description: Controls the enable state of the selected trigger.

EnumEntry.Name: Off
EnumEntry.Description: The selected trigger is turned off.

EnumEntry.Name: On
EnumEntry.Description: The selected trigger is active.

Integer.Name: triggerFrameCount
Integer.Description: Sets the maximum number of frames to acquire when a valid trigger is received. This feature is available when Trigger Selector = MultiFrame Trigger(Start).

Integer.Name: AcquisitionBurstFrameCount
Integer.ToolTip: Number of frames to acquire for each FrameBurst trigger
Integer.Description: Sets the maximum number of frames to acquire when a valid trigger is received. This feature is used when the Trigger Selector is set to FrameBurstStart.

Command.Name: TriggerSoftware
Command.Description: Generate a software command internal trigger immediately no matter what the TriggerSource feature is set to.

Enumeration.Name: TriggerSource
Enumeration.Description: Specifies the internal signal or physical input line to use as the trigger source. The selected trigger must have its TriggerMode set to ON.

EnumEntry.Name: Line1
EnumEntry.Description: Select Line 1 (and associated I/O control block) to use as the external trigger source. See LineSelector feature for complete list.

EnumEntry.Name: Line2
EnumEntry.Description: Select Line 2 (and associated I/O control block) to use as the external trigger source. See LineSelector feature for complete list.

EnumEntry.Name: Software
EnumEntry.Description: The trigger command source is only generated by software using the Trigger Software command.

EnumEntry.Name: Action1
EnumEntry.Description: Select the GigEVision Action Command 1 as the internal trigger source. This is a broadcast command that multiple devices can respond to simultaneously.

EnumEntry.Name: timestampModuloEvent
EnumEntry.Description: Select the Timestamp modulo event as the internal trigger source.

EnumEntry.Name: Timer1End
EnumEntry.Description: Select the TimerEnd Event as the internal trigger source.

EnumEntry.Name: Counter1End
EnumEntry.Description: Select the CounterEnd Event as the internal trigger source.

Float.Name: TriggerDelay
Float.Description: Specifies the delay in microseconds to apply after receiving the trigger and before activating the triggerEvent.

Enumeration.Name: TriggerActivation
Enumeration.ToolTip: The transition of the Input Line of the selected trigger source.
Enumeration.Description: Select the activation mode for the selected Input Line trigger source. This is applicable only for external line inputs.

EnumEntry.Name: RisingEdge
EnumEntry.Description: The trigger is considered valid on the rising edge of the line source signal (after being process by the line inverter feature).

EnumEntry.Name: FallingEdge
EnumEntry.Description: The trigger is considered valid on the falling edge of the line source signal (after being process by the line inverter feature).

EnumEntry.Name: AnyEdge
EnumEntry.Description: The trigger is considered valid on any edge (falling or rising) of the line source signal (after being process by the line inverter feature).

EnumEntry.Name: LevelHigh
EnumEntry.Description: The trigger is considered valid on the high level of the line source signal

EnumEntry.Name: LevelLow
EnumEntry.Description: The trigger is considered valid on the low level of the line source signal.

Enumeration.Name: TriggerOverlap
Enumeration.Description: States if a trigger overlap is permitted with the Active Frame readout signal. This feature defines if a new valid trigger will be accepted (or latched) for a new frame.

EnumEntry.Name: Off
EnumEntry.Description: No trigger overlap is permitted.

EnumEntry.Name: ReadOut
EnumEntry.Description: Trigger is accepted immediately after the start of the readout.

EnumEntry.Name: EndOfExposure
EnumEntry.Description: Trigger is accepted immediately after the previous exposure period. This will latch the Trigger and delay the Exposure if the end of that exposure is shorter than the previous readout.

Enumeration.Name: LineSelector
Enumeration.Description: Selects the physical line (or pin) of the external device connector to configure.

EnumEntry.Name: Line1
EnumEntry.Description: Index of the physical line and associated I/O control block to use. Pin 5 is the Input Signal and Pin 3 is the common Ground on the I/O connector.

EnumEntry.Name: Line2
EnumEntry.Description: Index of the physical line and associated I/O control block to use. Pin 7 is the Input Signal and Pin 3 is the common Ground on the I/O connector.

EnumEntry.Name: Line3
EnumEntry.Description: Index of the physical line and associated I/O control block to use. Pin 6 is the Output Signal and Pin 4 is the common output power on the I/O connector.

EnumEntry.Name: Line4
EnumEntry.Description: Index of the physical line and associated I/O control block to use. Pin 8 is the Output Signal and Pin 4 is the common output power on the I/O connector.

Enumeration.Name: lineName
Enumeration.ToolTip: Description of the physical Pin associated with the logical line
Enumeration.Description: Description of the physical Pin associated with the logical line

EnumEntry.Name: Input1
EnumEntry.Description: Associated with the logical line Input 1

EnumEntry.Name: Input2
EnumEntry.Description: Associated with the logical line Input 2

EnumEntry.Name: Output1
EnumEntry.Description: Associated with the logical line Output 1

EnumEntry.Name: Output2
EnumEntry.Description: Associated with the logical line Output 2

Enumeration.Name: linePinAssociation
Enumeration.ToolTip: Physical pin location associated with the logical line
Enumeration.Description: Enumeration of the physical line (or pin) on the I/O device connector.

EnumEntry.Name: Pin5Signal_Pin3Gnd
EnumEntry.Description: Pin 5 is the Input Signal and Pin 3 is the common input Ground on the I/O connector.

EnumEntry.Name: Pin7Signal_Pin3Gnd
EnumEntry.Description: Pin 7 is the Input2 Signal and Pin 3 is the common input Ground on the device connector.

EnumEntry.Name: Pin6Signal_Pin4Pwr
EnumEntry.Description: Pin 6 is the Output Signal and Pin 4 is the common output Power on the device connector.

EnumEntry.Name: Pin8Signal_Pin4Pwr
EnumEntry.Description: Pin 8 is the Output2 Signal and Pin 4 is the common output Power on the device connector.

Enumeration.Name: LineMode
Enumeration.Description: Reports if the physical Line is an Input or Output signal.

EnumEntry.Name: Input
EnumEntry.Description: The line is an input line.

EnumEntry.Name: Output
EnumEntry.Description: The line is an output line.

Enumeration.Name: LineFormat
Enumeration.ToolTip: Specify the current electrical format of the selected physical input or output.
Enumeration.Description: Specify the current electrical format of the selected physical input or output.

EnumEntry.Name: OptoCoupled
EnumEntry.Description: The line is opto-Coupled.

Enumeration.Name: lineDetectionLevel
Enumeration.Description: Specifies the voltage threshold required to recognize a signal transition on an input line.

EnumEntry.Name: Threshold_for_TTL
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Valid detection range under 0.8 Volt and over 2.4 Volt
EnumEntry.Description: A signal below 0.8V will be detected as a Logical LOW and a signal greater then 2.4V will be detected as a Logical HIGH on the selected input line.

Boolean.Name: LineInverter
Boolean.ToolTip: Set the polarity of the line
Boolean.Description: Control to invert the polarity of the selected input or output line signal.

Integer.Name: lineDebouncingPeriod
Integer.ToolTip: Debouncing Period of the Input Line
Integer.Description: Specifies the minimum delay before an input line voltage transition is recognizing as a signal transition.

Boolean.Name: LineStatus
Boolean.Description: Returns the current status of the selected input or output line.

Enumeration.Name: outputLineSource
Enumeration.Description: Selects which internal signal or event driven pulse or software control state to output on the selected output line.

EnumEntry.Name: Off
EnumEntry.Description: Line output is Open

EnumEntry.Name: SoftwareControlled
EnumEntry.ToolTip: The OutputLineValue feature changes the state of the output.
EnumEntry.Description: The OutputLineValue feature changes the state of the output.

EnumEntry.Name: PulseOnStartofFrame
EnumEntry.Description: Generate a pulse on the start of the Frame Active event.

EnumEntry.Name: PulseOnStartofExposure
EnumEntry.Description: Generate a pulse on the ExposureStart event. This option is typically used to trigger a strobe light.

EnumEntry.Name: PulseOnEndofExposure
EnumEntry.Description: Generate a pulse on the ExposureEnd event. This option is typically used to trigger a strobe light.

EnumEntry.Name: PulseOnStartofReadout
EnumEntry.Description: Generate a pulse on the ReadoutStart event.

EnumEntry.Name: PulseOnEndofReadout
EnumEntry.Description: Generate a pulse on the ReadoutEnd event.

EnumEntry.Name: PulseOnValidFrameTrigger
EnumEntry.Description: Generate a pulse on the FrameTrigger event.

EnumEntry.Name: PulseOnInvalidFrameTrigger
EnumEntry.Description: Generate a pulse on the Invalid FrameTrigger event.

EnumEntry.Name: PulseOnStartofAcquisition
EnumEntry.Description: Generate a pulse when the AcquisiontStart event occurs.

EnumEntry.Name: PulseOnEndofAcquisition
EnumEntry.Description: Generate a pulse when the AcquisiontStop event occurs.

EnumEntry.Name: PulseOnEndofTimer1
EnumEntry.Description: Generate a pulse on the TimerEnd 1 event.

EnumEntry.Name: PulseOnEndofCounter1
EnumEntry.Description: Generate a pulse on the CounterEnd 1 event.

EnumEntry.Name: PulseOnInput1
EnumEntry.Description: Generate a pulse on the Input signal 1 event.

EnumEntry.Name: PulseOnInput2
EnumEntry.Description: Generate a pulse on the Input signal 2 event.

EnumEntry.Name: PulseOnAction1
EnumEntry.Description: Generate a pulse on the GigEVision Action Command 1.

EnumEntry.Name: PulseOnAction2
EnumEntry.Description: Generate a pulse on the GigEVision Action Command 2.

EnumEntry.Name: PulseOnSoftwareCmd
EnumEntry.Description: Generate a pulse on the Input of a Software Command

EnumEntry.Name: ExposureActive
EnumEntry.Description: Generate a signal that is active when the Exposure is active.

Enumeration.Name: outputLineValue
Enumeration.Description: Sets the output state of the selected Line if the outputLineSoftwareLatchControl = OFF. OutputLineSource must be SoftwareControlled. If the outputLineSoftwareLatchControl = Latch , the state of the pin will change with the outputLineSoftwareCmd command.

EnumEntry.Name: Active
EnumEntry.Description: Sets the Output circuit to close

EnumEntry.Name: Inactive
EnumEntry.Description: Sets the Output circuit to open

Integer.Name: outputLinePulseDelay
Integer.Description: Sets the delay before the output line pulse duration signal. Applicable for the OutputLineSource feature.

Integer.Name: outputLinePulseDuration
Integer.Description: Sets the width (duration) of the output line pulse in microseconds.

Enumeration.Name: outputLinePulseActivation
Enumeration.ToolTip: Specifies the input line activation mode to trigger the OutputLine pulse.
Enumeration.Description: Specifies the input line activation mode to trigger the OutputLine pulse.

EnumEntry.Name: RisingEdge
EnumEntry.Description: Specifies that the trigger is considered valid on the rising edge of the source signal.-

EnumEntry.Name: FallingEdge
EnumEntry.Description: Specifies that the trigger is considered valid on the falling edge of the source signal.-

EnumEntry.Name: AnyEdge
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Trigger valid on falling or rising edge.
EnumEntry.Description: Specifies that the trigger is considered valid on the falling or rising edge of the source signal.

Enumeration.Name: outputLineSoftwareLatchControl
Enumeration.Description: When Off, the selected output line is set with the value in Output Line Value.

EnumEntry.Name: Off
EnumEntry.Description: Output pin state set by outputLineValue.

EnumEntry.Name: Latch
EnumEntry.Description: Output pin state set by outputLineSoftwareCmd.

Integer.Name: LineStatusAll
Integer.Description: Returns the current status of all available line signals, at time of polling, in a single bit field. The order is Line1, Line2, ...

Integer.Name: outputLineSoftwareCmd
Integer.Description: Writing a value of 1 in the bit field applies the Latch value of the outputLineSoftwareLatchControl and/or executes the PulseOnSoftwareCmd for any output line programmed for software control. The feature outputLineSoftwareCmd can take any binary value and each bit set to 1 corresponds to a Icommand for an Output. Note that Outputs are numbered from 1 to N, therefore Bit 1 of outputLineSoftwareCmd corresponds to Output1. This is applicable to OutputLineSource = Pulse On: where Software Cmd (for Pulse mode) or OutputLineSource = SoftwareControlled and OutputLineSoftwareLatchControl = Latch (for static states).

Category.Name: deviceCounterAndTimerControl
Category.ToolTip: Category that contains the Generic Counters and Timers related features.

Enumeration.Name: counterSelector
Enumeration.Description: Selects the counter to configure.

EnumEntry.Name: Counter1
EnumEntry.Description: Select counter 1

Enumeration.Name: counterMode
Enumeration.Description: Selects the counter mode. The selected Counter is either Active or Disabled. When Disabled, the Counter can be configured

EnumEntry.Name: Off
EnumEntry.Description: The selected Counter is Disable.

EnumEntry.Name: Active
EnumEntry.Description: The selected Counter is Enable.

Enumeration.Name: counterStatus
Enumeration.Description: Returns the current state of the counter.

EnumEntry.Name: CounterIdle
EnumEntry.Description: The counter is idle. The counterStartSource feature is set to off.

EnumEntry.Name: CounterTriggerWait
EnumEntry.Description: The counter is waiting for a start trigger.

EnumEntry.Name: CounterActive
EnumEntry.Description: The counter is counting for the specified duration.

EnumEntry.Name: CounterCompleted
EnumEntry.Description: The counter reached the counterDuration count.

EnumEntry.Name: CounterOverflow
EnumEntry.Description: The counter reached its maximum possible count.

Enumeration.Name: counterStartSource
Enumeration.Description: Select the counter start source. Counter increments from 0 to the value of the counterDuration feature.

EnumEntry.Name: Off
EnumEntry.Description: Counter is stopped.

EnumEntry.Name: AcquisitionStart
EnumEntry.Description: Counter starts on the reception of the Acquisition Start event.

EnumEntry.Name: AcquisitionEnd
EnumEntry.Description: Counter starts on the reception of the Acquisition End event.

EnumEntry.Name: ExposureStart
EnumEntry.Description: Counter starts on the reception of the Exposure Start event.

EnumEntry.Name: ExposureEnd
EnumEntry.Description: Counter starts on the reception of the Exposure End event.

EnumEntry.Name: ReadoutStart
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Start the counter on the reception of the Readout Start event.
EnumEntry.Description: Counter starts on the reception of the Readout Start event.

EnumEntry.Name: ReadoutEnd
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Start the counter on the reception of the Readout End event.
EnumEntry.Description: Counter starts on the reception of the Readout End event.

EnumEntry.Name: FrameStart
EnumEntry.Description: Counter starts on the reception of the Frame Start event.

EnumEntry.Name: ValidFrameTrigger
EnumEntry.Description: Counter starts on the reception of the Valid Frame Trigger.

EnumEntry.Name: InvalidFrameTrigger
EnumEntry.Description: Counter starts on the reception of the Invalid Frame Trigger.

EnumEntry.Name: Action1
EnumEntry.Description: GigEVision Action Command 1. This is a broadcast command that multiple devices can respond to simultaneously.

EnumEntry.Name: Action2
EnumEntry.Description: GigEVision Action Command 2. This is a broadcast command that multiple devices can respond to simultaneously.

EnumEntry.Name: Line1
EnumEntry.Description: Counter starts on the specified transitions on Line 1.

EnumEntry.Name: Line2
EnumEntry.Description: Counter starts on the specified transitions on Line 2.

EnumEntry.Name: Timer1End
EnumEntry.Description: Counter starts on the reception of the Timer 1 End event.

EnumEntry.Name: Counter1End
EnumEntry.Description: Counter starts on the reception of the Counter 1 End event.

Enumeration.Name: counterStartLineActivation
Enumeration.Description: Selects the activation mode of the input line trigger which starts the counter. This is only applicable when the counterStartSource feature selects a physical Line.

EnumEntry.Name: RisingEdge
EnumEntry.Description: Activate the counter on the rising edge of the selected Line.

EnumEntry.Name: FallingEdge
EnumEntry.Description: Activate the counter on the falling edge of the selected Line.

EnumEntry.Name: AnyEdge
EnumEntry.Description: Activate the counter on the falling or rising edge of the selected Line.

Enumeration.Name: counterIncrementalSource
Enumeration.Description: Select the event source which increments the counter.

EnumEntry.Name: Off
EnumEntry.Description: Counter is stopped.

EnumEntry.Name: AcquisitionStart
EnumEntry.Description: Counts the number of Acquisition Start events.

EnumEntry.Name: AcquisitionEnd
EnumEntry.Description: Counts the number of Acquisition End events.

EnumEntry.Name: ExposureStart
EnumEntry.Description: Counts the number of Exposure Start events.

EnumEntry.Name: ExposureEnd
EnumEntry.Description: Counts the number of Exposure End events.

EnumEntry.Name: ReadoutStart
EnumEntry.Description: Counts the number of Readout Start events.

EnumEntry.Name: ReadoutEnd
EnumEntry.Description: Counts the number of Readout End events.

EnumEntry.Name: FrameStart
EnumEntry.Description: Counts the number of Frame Start events.

EnumEntry.Name: ValidFrameTrigger
EnumEntry.Description: Counts the number of Valid Frame Triggers.

EnumEntry.Name: InvalidFrameTrigger
EnumEntry.Description: Counts the number of Rejected Frame(s) Trigger.

EnumEntry.Name: FrameBurstEnd
EnumEntry.Description: Counts the number of multi-frame end triggers.

EnumEntry.Name: Line1
EnumEntry.Description: Counts the number of transitions on Line 1 (based on the counterIncrementalLineActivation feature setting).

EnumEntry.Name: Line2

EnumEntry.Name: Timer1End

Enumeration.Name: counterIncrementalLineActivation

EnumEntry.Name: FrameBurstEnd

EnumEntry.Name: RisingEdge

EnumEntry.Name: FallingEdge
EnumEntry.Description: Reset counter on the falling edge of the selected signal.

EnumEntry.Name: AnyEdge

Integer.Name: counterValue

Integer.Name: counterValueAtReset
Integer.Description: Reads the value of the selected counter when it was reset by a trigger or by an explicit Counter Reset command.

Command.Name: counterReset
Command.Description: Resets the selected counter to zero. The counter starts immediately after the reset. To temporarily disable the counter, set the Counter Event Source feature to Off.

Enumeration.Name: timerSelector
Enumeration.Description: Selects which timer to configure.

EnumEntry.Name: Timer1
EnumEntry.Description: Select Timer 1 to configure.

Enumeration.Name: timerMode

Enumeration.Name: timerStatus

EnumEntry.Name: TimerIdle
EnumEntry.Description: The timer is idle. The counterStartSource feature is set to off.

EnumEntry.Name: TimerTriggerWait

EnumEntry.Name: TimerActive

EnumEntry.Name: TimerCompleted

EnumEntry.Description: Starts with the reception of the timerReset Icommand.

EnumEntry.Name: AcquisitionEnd
EnumEntry.Description: Start Timer on Acquisition End event.

EnumEntry.Name: ExposureStart

EnumEntry.Name: ExposureEnd
EnumEntry.Description: Start Timer on Exposure End event.

EnumEntry.Name: ReadoutStart
EnumEntry.Description: Start Timer on Readout Start event.

EnumEntry.Name: ReadoutEnd
EnumEntry.Description: Start Timer on Readout End event.

EnumEntry.Name: FrameStart
EnumEntry.Description: Start Timer on Frame Start event.

EnumEntry.Name: ValidFrameTrigger

EnumEntry.Name: FrameBurstEnd
EnumEntry.Description: Start Timer on Frame Burst End event.

EnumEntry.Name: Action1

EnumEntry.Name: Action2

EnumEntry.Name: Line1

EnumEntry.Name: Timer1End

EnumEntry.Name: FallingEdge

EnumEntry.Name: AnyEdge

Integer.Name: timerDuration

Integer.Name: timerValue

Category.Name: dataProcessing
Category.ToolTip: Category of features related to image processing.

Enumeration.Name: lutMode
Enumeration.Description: Sets the enable state of the LUT module (Lookup Table).

EnumEntry.Name: Off
EnumEntry.Description: Disables the LUT.

EnumEntry.Name: Active
EnumEntry.Description: Enables the LUT module.

Enumeration.Name: lutType
Enumeration.Description: Displays the LUT type of the currently selected Lookup Table.

EnumEntry.Name: UserDefined
EnumEntry.Description: Uses the user programmable LUT.

EnumEntry.Name: GammaCorrection
EnumEntry.Description: Uses gamma LUT

Enumeration.Name: lutCurrentActiveSet
Enumeration.Description: Specifies the current LUT to use.

EnumEntry.Name: Luminance1
EnumEntry.Description: Sets the current LUT as Luminance 1.

Enumeration.Name: LUTSelector
Enumeration.Description: Selects which LUT to control and adjust features.

EnumEntry.Name: Luminance1
EnumEntry.Description: Luminance 1 is under control

Enumeration.Name: lutSize
Enumeration.Description: Specify the LUT size of the selected LUT (Lookup Table). Available choices are model dependent.

EnumEntry.Name: Bpp10
EnumEntry.Description: 10 bits per pixel

EnumEntry.Name: Bpp12
EnumEntry.Description: 12 bits per pixel

Integer.Name: LUTIndex
Integer.Description: Selects the index (offset) of the coefficient to access in the selected LUT.

Integer.Name: LUTValue
Integer.Description: Returns the value at specified LUT index entry of the LUT selected by the LUT Selector feature.

Register.Name: LUTValueAll
Register.Description: Accesses all the LUT coefficients in a single access without using individual LUT indices. This feature accesses the LUT values in the currently active LUT table set by the LUT Current Active Set feature.

Category.Name: cyclingPreset
Category.ToolTip: Feature category that allows cycling through multiple settings on a frame by frame or user defined basis.

Enumeration.Name: cyclingPresetMode
Enumeration.Description: Sets the Cycling Presets module mode.

EnumEntry.Name: Off
EnumEntry.Description: Disable the Cycling Preset module.

EnumEntry.Name: Active
EnumEntry.Description: Enable the Cycling Preset module.

StructReg.Comment: Register to set the mode of the preset

Integer.Name: cyclingPresetCount
Integer.Description: Specifies the number of Presets to use.

Integer.Name: cyclingPresetCurrentActiveSet
Integer.ToolTip: Index of the current active set
Integer.Description: Returns the index of the currently active cycling preset.

IntConverter.Name: cnvCyclingPresetCurrentActiveSet
IntConverter.ToolTip: Index of the current active set

Enumeration.Name: cyclingPresetIncrementalSource
Enumeration.Description: Specifies the source that increments the currently active cycling preset.

EnumEntry.Name: None
EnumEntry.Description: Feature cyclingPresetCurrentActiveSet is used to select the current active set.

EnumEntry.Name: ValidFrameTrigger
EnumEntry.Description: Increment on a Valid Frame Triggers.

EnumEntry.Name: Counter1End
EnumEntry.Description: Increment on the end of Counter 1.

EnumEntry.Name: StartOfFrame
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Increment at the Start of Frame
EnumEntry.Description: Increment on the Start of Frame event.

EnumEntry.Name: Line2
EnumEntry.Description: Select Line 2 (and associated I/O control block) to use as the external increment source.

Enumeration.Name: cyclingPresetIncrementalActivation
Enumeration.ToolTip: Active transition of the selected Input Line
Enumeration.Description: Select the activation mode for the selected Input Line source. This is applicable only for external line inputs.

EnumEntry.Name: RisingEdge
EnumEntry.Description: The source is considered valid on the rising edge of the line source signal (after being process by the line inverter feature).

EnumEntry.Name: FallingEdge
EnumEntry.Description: The source is considered valid on the falling edge of the line source signal (after being process by the line inverter feature).

EnumEntry.Name: AnyEdge
EnumEntry.Description: The source is considered valid on any edge (falling or rising) of the line source signal (after being process by the line inverter feature).

Enumeration.Name: cyclingPresetResetSource
Enumeration.Description: Specifies the source that resets the currently active preset. On reset the current preset index is set to 1.

EnumEntry.Name: ValidFrameTrigger
EnumEntry.Description: Reset when a Valid Frame Triggers occurs.

EnumEntry.Name: Counter1End
EnumEntry.Description: Reset when counter 1 ends.

EnumEntry.Name: EndOfAcquisition
EnumEntry.Description: Use End of Acquisition as the reset source. An End of Acquisition occurs on acquisition stop.

EnumEntry.Name: Software
EnumEntry.Description: Use a software command as the reset source.

Command.Name: cyclingPresetResetCmd
Command.Description: Reset the position of the preset cycling to 1 and the count to 0.

Integer.Name: cyclingPresetRepeater
Integer.Description: Specifies the required number of cycling preset increment events (generated by the Cycling Preset Incremental Source) to increment the index of the Cycling Preset Current Active Set.

Enumeration.Name: cP_FeaturesActivationSelector
Enumeration.ToolTip: Selects the CP Feature to Activate or Disable
Enumeration.Description: Selects the feature to control by the cP_FeaturesActivationMode feature.

EnumEntry.Name: ExposureTime
EnumEntry.Description: The cP_FeaturesActivationMode feature controls the exposure time.

EnumEntry.Name: ExposureDelay
EnumEntry.Description: The cP_FeaturesActivationMode feature controls the exposure delay.

EnumEntry.Name: ROI_Position
EnumEntry.Description: The cP_FeaturesActivationMode feature will control ROI position.

EnumEntry.Name: OutputLine3Control
EnumEntry.Description: The cP_FeaturesActivationMode feature controls the output line3.

EnumEntry.Name: OutputLine4Control
EnumEntry.Description: The cP_FeaturesActivationMode feature controls the output line4.

EnumEntry.Name: BinningHorizontal
EnumEntry.Description: The cP_FeaturesActivationMode controls the horizontal binning.

EnumEntry.Name: BinningVertical
EnumEntry.Description: The cP_FeaturesActivationMode controls the vertical binning.

Enumeration.Name: cP_FeaturesActivationMode
Enumeration.Description: Enables the selected feature to be part of the cycling. When activating the selected feature, this will automatically set the corresponding standard camera feature to read only.

EnumEntry.Name: Off
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Exclude the selected feature from cycling
EnumEntry.Description: Exclude the selected feature from the cycling.

EnumEntry.Name: Active
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Activate the selected feature in the cycling
EnumEntry.Description: Include the selected feature in the cycling.

Integer.Name: cP_PresetConfigurationSelector
Integer.ToolTip: Selects the cycling preset to configure
Integer.Description: Selects the cycling preset to configure.

Integer.Name: cP_ExposureTime
Integer.Description: Sets the exposure time (in microseconds) for the selected set. The maximum frame rate is dependent on the longest cycling exposure time.

Integer.Name: cP_ExposureDelay
Integer.Description: Sets the exposure delay (in microseconds) for the selected set.

Integer.Name: cP_OffsetX
Integer.ToolTip: OffsetX from Sensor Origin to ROI
Integer.Description: Horizontal offset from the origin to the region of interest (ROI). The value in this feature is only used when the currently selected cycling preset is active.

Integer.Name: cP_OffsetY
Integer.ToolTip: OffsetY from Sensor Origin to ROI
Integer.Description: Vertical offset from the origin to the region of interest (ROI). The value in this feature is only used when the currently selected cycling preset is active.

Enumeration.Name: cP_LineSelector
Enumeration.Description: Selects which physical line (or pin) of the external device connector to configure.

EnumEntry.Name: Line3
EnumEntry.Description: Index of the physical line and associated I/O control block to use. Pin 6 is the Output Signal and Pin 4 is the common output power on the I/O connector.

EnumEntry.Name: Line4
EnumEntry.Description: Index of the physical line and associated I/O control block to use. Pin 8 is the Output Signal and Pin 4 is the common output power on the I/O connector.

Enumeration.Name: cP_OutputLineValue
Enumeration.Description: Sets the output state of the selected Line if the outputLineSoftwareLatchControl = OFF. OutputLineSource must be SoftwareControlled. If the outputLineSoftwareLatchControl = Latch , the state of the pin will change with the outputLineSoftwareCmd command.

EnumEntry.Name: Active
EnumEntry.Description: Sets the Output circuit to closed.

EnumEntry.Name: Inactive
EnumEntry.Description: Sets the Output circuit to open.

Enumeration.Name: cP_OutputLineSource
Enumeration.Description: Selects which internal signal, or event driven pulse, or software control state to output on the selected output line.

EnumEntry.Name: Off
EnumEntry.Description: Line output is Open

EnumEntry.Name: SoftwareControlled
EnumEntry.ToolTip: The OutputLineValue feature changes the state of the output.
EnumEntry.Description: The OutputLineValue feature changes the state of the output.

EnumEntry.Name: PulseOnStartofExposure
EnumEntry.Description: Generate a pulse on the ExposureStart event. This option is typically used to trigger a strobe light.

EnumEntry.Name: ExposureActive
EnumEntry.Description: Generate a signal that is active when the Exposure is active.

Integer.Name: cP_BinningHorizontal
Integer.Description: Number of horizontal photo-sensitive cells to combine together. This increases the intensity of the pixels but reduces the horizontal resolution of the image.

Integer.Name: cP_BinningVertical
Integer.Description: Number of vertical photo-sensitive cells to combine together. This increases the intensity of the pixels but reduces the vertical resolution of the image.

Enumeration.Name: binningSelector
Enumeration.Description: Select how the Horizontal and Vertical Binning is done. The Binning function can occur in the Digital domain of a device or at the actual sensor.

EnumEntry.Name: InSensor
EnumEntry.Description: The Binning function can be done inside the Sensor itself, which often allows binning to increase the data rate from the sensor.

EnumEntry.Name: InDigitalDomain
EnumEntry.Description: The Binning function can be done inside the device but with a digital processing function. Binning doesn’t affect the current data rate from the sensor or camera.

Integer.Name: BinningHorizontal
Integer.Description: Number of horizontal photo-sensitive cells to combine together. This increases the intensity of the pixels but reduces the horizontal resolution of the image.

Integer.Name: BinningVertical
Integer.Description: Number of vertical photo-sensitive cells to combine together. This increases the intensity of the pixels but reduces the vertical resolution of the image.

Enumeration.Name: TestImageSelector
Enumeration.Description: Selects the type of test image that is sent by the camera.

EnumEntry.Name: Off
EnumEntry.Description: Image is from the camera sensor.

EnumEntry.Name: GreyHorizontalRamp
EnumEntry.Description: Image is filled horizontally with an image that goes from the darkest possible value to the brightest.

EnumEntry.Name: GreyVerticalRamp
EnumEntry.Description: Image is filled vertically with an image that goes from the darkest possible value to the brightest.

EnumEntry.Name: GreyDiagonalRampMoving
EnumEntry.Description: Image is filled horizontally and vertically with an image that goes from the darkest possible value to the brightest by 1 Dn increment per pixel and that moves horizontally from right to left at each frame by one pixel

Boolean.Name: AcquisitionStatus
Boolean.Description: Reads the state of the internal acquisition signal selected using the Acquisition Status Selector feature.

Enumeration.Name: AcquisitionMode
Enumeration.Description: Set the acquisition mode of the device. It defines the number of frames to capture during an acquisition and the way the acquisition stops.

EnumEntry.Name: SingleFrame
EnumEntry.Description: One frame is captured for each AcquisitionStart Command. An AcquisitionStop occurs at the end of the Active Frame.

EnumEntry.Name: MultiFrame
EnumEntry.Description: A sequence of frames is captured for each AcquisitionStart Command. The number of frames is specified by AcquisitionFrameCount feature. An AcquisitionStop occurs at the end of the Active Frame(s).

EnumEntry.Name: Continuous
EnumEntry.Description: Frames are captured continuously with AcquisitionStart until stopped with the AcquisitionStop command.

Command.Name: AcquisitionStart
Command.ToolTip: Start image capture using currently selected acquisition mode
Command.Description: Start image capture using the currently selected acquisition mode. The number of frames captured is specified by AcquisitionMode feature.

Command.Name: AcquisitionStop
Command.Description: Stops the Acquisition of the device at the end of the current frame unless the triggerFrameCount feature is greater than 1.

Command.Name: AcquisitionAbort
Command.Description: Aborts the acquisition immediately. This will end the capture without completing the current frame or aborts waiting on a trigger. If no acquisition is in progress, the command is ignored.

Command.Name: AcquisitionArm
Command.Description: Arms the device before an AcquisitionStart command. This optional command validates all the current features for consistency and prepares the device for a fast start of the acquisition. If not used explicitly, this command is automatically executed at the first AcquisitionStart but will not be repeated for subsequent ones unless a data transfer related feature is changed in the device.

Integer.Name: AcquisitionFrameCount
Integer.Description: Number of frames to be acquired in MultiFrame acquisition mode.

Command.Name: DeviceRegistersStreamingStart
Command.Description: Announces the start of registers streaming without immediate checking for consistency.

Command.Name: DeviceRegistersStreamingEnd
Command.Description: Announces end of registers streaming and performs validation for registers consistency before activating them.

Command.Name: DeviceFeaturePersistenceStart
Command.Description: Announces the start of feature streaming without immediate checking for consistency.

Command.Name: DeviceFeaturePersistenceEnd
Command.Description: Announces end of feature streaming and performs validation for feature consistency before activating them.

Command.Name: DeviceRegistersCheck
Command.Description: Performs an explicit register set validation for consistency.

Boolean.Name: DeviceRegistersValid
Boolean.Description: States if the current register set is valid and consistent.

Enumeration.Name: TransferControlMode
Enumeration.Description: Sets the method used to control the transfer.

EnumEntry.Name: Basic
EnumEntry.Description: Basic mode ensures maximum compatibility but does not allow for control of the transfer flow.

EnumEntry.Name: UserControlled
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Transfer flow is controlled by the user
EnumEntry.Description: Manual mode allows maximum control of the transfer flow.

Integer.Name: transferQueueCurrentBlockCount
Integer.Description: Returns the current number of blocks in the transfer queue.

Float.Name: transferQueueMemorySize
Float.ToolTip: Memory reserved (in MBytes) for internal image frame accumulation in the transfer queue
Float.Description: Indicates the amount of device memory (in MBytes) available for internal image frame accumulation in the transfer queue. Increasing or decreasing memory reserved by devicePacketResendBufferSize will affect total memory available here.

Float.Name: transferMaxBlockSize
Float.Description: Biggest image (GEV blocks) data size sent on the GigE cable. The value is displayed in Megabytes. Use this value to calculate the frame rate transferred on the GigE cable. GigE Link speed (~115 MB) divided by Biggest image (value) = Max fps transferred.

Float.Name: transferMinBlockSize
Float.Description: Smallest image (GEV blocks) data size sent on the GigE cable. The value is displayed in Megabytes.

Float.Name: transferAverageBlockSize
Float.Description: Average size of the last 16 images (GEV blocks) of data sent on the GigE cable. The value is displayed in Megabytes. Use this value to calculate the sustained frame rate transferred on the GigE cable. GigE Link speed (~115 MB) divided by Average size (value) = Max fps transferred. When TurboDrive is enabled, this feature allows monitoring the average throughput.

SwissKnife.Name: maxSustainedFrameRate
SwissKnife.Description: Maximum sustained frame rate that can be achieved by the camera in the current configuration (Resolution, Pixel Format and the camera's internal bandwidth limitations). When TurboDrive is enabled, this value also takes the feature transferAverageBlockSize into account.

Category.Name: ActionControl
Category.ToolTip: Category that contains the Action control features
Category.Description: Contains the features related to the control of the Action Command mechanism.

Integer.Name: ActionDeviceKey
Integer.ToolTip: Key used to identify a group of devices
Integer.Description: Provides the device key that allows the device to check the validity of action commands.

Integer.Name: ActionSelector
Integer.ToolTip: Selects the action command to configure.
Integer.Description: Selects the action command to configure. Certain Nano fetures support 2 Action commands.

Integer.Name: ActionGroupKey
Integer.ToolTip: Key used to identify a group action group
Integer.Description: Provides the key that the device uses to validate that the action command message is part of the requested group.

Integer.Name: ActionGroupMask
Integer.ToolTip: Mask used to filer out particular event in a group
Integer.Description: Provides the mask used to filter particular action command messages for the selected action.

Category.ToolTip: Category that contains the camera Event related features.

Enumeration.Name: timestampSource
Enumeration.Description: Specifies the source used as the incrementing signal for the Timestamp register.

EnumEntry.Name: InternalClock
EnumEntry.Description: The Timestamp source is generated by the camera internal clock. Refer to the timestampTickFrequency feature for the time base.

EnumEntry.Name: IEEE1588
EnumEntry.Description: The Timestamp source is controlled by the network IEEE1588 protocol. This source is automatically selected when PTP mode is enabled.

Integer.Name: timestampValue
Integer.Description: Returns the 64-bit value of the Timestamp, which is the internal Clock timer or the PTP clock timer, depending on the Timestamp Source selection.

Integer.Name: GevTimestampValue
Integer.ToolTip: Returns the 64-bit value of the Timestamp counter.
Integer.Description: Returns the 64-bit value of the Timestamp counter.

IntReg.Name: BootStrap_GevTimestampValueLatchedHigh
IntReg.Description: Current Gev Timestamp Value Latched High Register

IntReg.Name: BootStrap_GevTimestampValueLatchedLow
IntReg.Description: Current Gev Timestamp Value Latched Low Register

Command.Name: timestampControlReset
Command.Description: Resets the Timestamp counter to 0. This Feature resets both the internal Clock timer and the PTP clock timer. Note that the PTP Mode must be disabled first to reset the PTP clock timer.

Command.Name: GevTimestampControlReset
Command.Description: same as timestampControlReset

Command.Name: timestampControlLatch
Command.Description: Latch the current Timestamp internal counter value in the timestampValue feature.

Command.Name: GevTimestampControlLatch
Command.Description: same as timestampControlLatch

Integer.Name: timestampTickFrequency
Integer.Description: Indicates the number of Timestamp ticks (or increments) during 1 second (frequency in Hz). This feature changes depending on the Timestamp Source.

Integer.Name: GevTimestampTickFrequency
Integer.Description: same as timestampTickFrequency

IntReg.Name: BootStrap_GevtimestampTickFrequencyHigh
IntReg.Description: Current Gev Timestamp Tick Frequency High Register

IntReg.Name: BootStrap_GevtimestampTickFrequencyLow
IntReg.Description: Current Gev Timestamp Tick Frequency Low Register

Enumeration.Name: timestampLatchSource
Enumeration.Description: Specifies the internal event or signal that will latch the Timestamp counter into the Timestamp buffer.

EnumEntry.Name: FrameStart
EnumEntry.Description: The Timestamp is latched on frame start.

Enumeration.Name: EventSelector
Enumeration.Description: Select the Event to enable/disable with the EventNotification feature.

EnumEntry.Name: FrameStart
EnumEntry.Description: Event sent on control channel on an Active Frame. This occurs with the start of the exposure delay.

EnumEntry.Name: ExposureStart
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Event sent when the exposure start
EnumEntry.Description: Event sent on control channel on start of exposure.

EnumEntry.Name: ExposureEnd
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Event sent when the exposure end
EnumEntry.Description: Event sent on control channel on end of exposure.

EnumEntry.Name: AcquisitionStartNextValid
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Event sent when the acquisition start can be used again
EnumEntry.Description: Event sent on control channel when the AcquisitionStart command can be used again.

EnumEntry.Name: ValidFrameTrigger
EnumEntry.Description: Event sent on control channel when a valid frame trigger is generated.

EnumEntry.Name: InvalidFrameTrigger
EnumEntry.Description: Event sent on control channel when a frame trigger occurs in an invalid Trigger region. Therefore the trigger is rejected and no frame acquisition occurs.

EnumEntry.Name: ImageLost
EnumEntry.Description: Event sent on control channel when an image is lost due to insufficient memory.

EnumEntry.Name: eventsOverflow
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Event sent to indicate that all events have been disabled because the camera cannot send them fast enough.
EnumEntry.Description: Event sent on control channel when all previous active events have been disabled because the camera cannot send them fast enough, generating in internal message overflow. All required events must be re-enabled manually.

Enumeration.Name: EventNotification
Enumeration.ToolTip: Enable Events selected by EventSelector feature.
Enumeration.Description: Enable Events for the event type selected by the EventSelector feature.

EnumEntry.Name: Off
EnumEntry.Description: The selected event is disabled.

EnumEntry.Name: On
EnumEntry.Description: The selected event will generate a software event.

EnumEntry.Name: GigEVisionEvent
EnumEntry.Description: The selected event will generate a software event. This entry is deprecated. Using "On" is recommended.

Enumeration.Name: eventStatisticSelector
Enumeration.ToolTip: Selects which Event statistic to display
Enumeration.Description: Selects which Event statistic to display.

EnumEntry.Name: InvalidFrameTrigger
EnumEntry.Description: Counts the frame triggers occurring in an invalid Trigger region.

EnumEntry.Name: ImageLost
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Image lost in the camera due to insufficient memory
EnumEntry.Description: Image is acquired but lost before it’s been transferred.

EnumEntry.Name: PacketResend
EnumEntry.Description: Counts the number of individual packets that are resent.

EnumEntry.Name: PacketResendRequestDropped
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Number of packet resend request dropped
EnumEntry.Description: Counts the number of packet resend requests dropped. The camera queues the packet resend requests until they are processed. There is a limit to the number of requests that can be queued by the camera. When a new request is received and the queue is full, the request is dropped but this statistic is still incremented.

EnumEntry.Name: EthernetPauseFrameReceived
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Number of Ethernet Pause Frame received
EnumEntry.Description: Counts the number of Ethernet Pause Frame received.

Command.ToolTip: Reset the count of the selected Event
Command.Description: Reset the count of the selected Event.

Enumeration.Name: ptpMode
Enumeration.Description: Specifies the PTP (IEEE-1588: Precision Time Protocol) operating mode as implemented by the Genie Nano.

EnumEntry.Name: Off
EnumEntry.Description: PTP is disabled on the device.

EnumEntry.Name: Automatic
EnumEntry.Description: PTP is enabled on the device. The camera can become a Master or Slave device. The Master device is automatically determined as per IEEE-1588.

EnumEntry.Name: Slave
EnumEntry.Description: Device will operate in PTP slave-only mode.

Enumeration.Name: ptpStatus
Enumeration.Description: Specifies dynamically the current PTP state of the device. (ref: IEEE Std 1588-2008)

EnumEntry.Name: Initializing
EnumEntry.Description: The port initializes its data sets, hardware, and communication facilities. No port of the clock shall place any PTP messages on its communication path. If one port of a boundary clock is in the INITIALIZING state, then all ports shall be in the INITIALIZING state.

EnumEntry.Name: Faulty
EnumEntry.Description: The fault state of the protocol. A port in this state shall not place any PTP messages except for management messages that are a required response to another management message on its communication path. In a boundary clock, no activity on a faulty port shall affect the other ports of the device. If fault activity on a port in this state cannot be confined to the faulty port, then all ports shall be in the FAULTY state.

EnumEntry.Name: Disabled
EnumEntry.Description: The port shall not place any messages on its communication path. In a boundary clock, no activity at the port shall be allowed to affect the activity at any other port of the boundary clock. A port in this state shall discard all PTP received messages except for management messages.

EnumEntry.Name: Listening
EnumEntry.Description: The port is waiting for the announceReceiptTimeout to expire or to receive an Announce message from a master. The purpose of this state is to allow orderly addition of clocks to a domain. A port in this state shall not place any PTP messages on its communication path except for Pdelay_Req, Pdelay_Resp, Pdelay_Resp_Follow_Up, or signaling messages, or management messages that are a required response to another management message.

EnumEntry.Name: PreMaster
EnumEntry.Description: The port shall behave in all respects as though it were in the MASTER state except that it shall not place any messages on its communication path except for Pdelay_Req, Pdelay_Resp, Pdelay_Resp_Follow_Up, signaling, or management messages.

EnumEntry.Name: Master
EnumEntry.Description: The port is behaving as a master port.

EnumEntry.Name: Passive
EnumEntry.Description: The port shall not place any messages on its communication path except for Pdelay_Req, Pdelay_Resp, Pdelay_Resp_Follow_Up, or signaling messages, or management messages that are a required response to another management message.

EnumEntry.Name: Uncalibrated
EnumEntry.Description: One or more master ports have been detected in the domain. The appropriate master port has been selected, and the local port is preparing to synchronize to the selected master port. This is a transient state to allow initialization of synchronization servos, updating of data sets when a new master port has been selected, and other implementation-specific activity.

EnumEntry.Name: Slave
EnumEntry.Description: The port is synchronizing to the selected master port.

EnumEntry.Name: GrandMaster
EnumEntry.Description: The port is in the Grand Master state (i.e. has the best clock). The camera can become GrandMaster only if the PTP Mode=Automatic and there's another device on the network that was Master.

EnumEntry.Name: Error
EnumEntry.Description: One or more ports have an error state.

Enumeration.Name: ptpServoStatus
Enumeration.Description: Specifies the IEEE1588 servo status.

EnumEntry.Name: Unlocked
EnumEntry.Description: The servo is not yet ready to track the master clock.

EnumEntry.Name: Synchronizing
EnumEntry.Description: The servo is unlocked and synchronizing to the master clock.

EnumEntry.Name: Locked
EnumEntry.Description: The servo is adjusting (syntonizing) to the master clock.

EnumEntry.Name: NotApplicable
EnumEntry.Description: The servo state is currently not applicable.

StringReg.Name: ptpMasterClockId
StringReg.Description: Port identity of the current best master. The clock ID is an Extended Unique Identifier (EUI)-64 64-bit ID, converted from the 48-bit MAC address, by inserting 0xfffe at the middle of the MAC address.

Integer.Name: ptpMasterOffsetNs
Integer.ToolTip: Returns the 64-bit value of the PTP offset with the master.
Integer.Description: Dynamically returns the 64-bit value of the PTP offset with the master. This value is the input for clock corrections for the slave device clock servo algorithms.

Enumeration.Name: ptpPortLastEvent
Enumeration.Description: Logs the last PTP changed state event defining the last current status.

EnumEntry.Name: None
EnumEntry.Description: None

EnumEntry.Description: Power up

EnumEntry.Name: Initialize
EnumEntry.Description: Initialize

EnumEntry.Name: DesignatedEnabled
EnumEntry.Description: Designated Enabled

EnumEntry.Name: DesignatedDisabled
EnumEntry.Description: Designated Disabled

EnumEntry.Description: Announce Receipt Timeout Expires

EnumEntry.Name: SynchronizationFault
EnumEntry.Description: Synchronization Fault

EnumEntry.Name: MasterClockSelected
EnumEntry.Description: Master Clock Selected

EnumEntry.Name: RS_Master
EnumEntry.Description: Recommended State Master

EnumEntry.Name: RS_GrandMaster
EnumEntry.Description: Recommended State Grand Master

EnumEntry.Name: RS_Slave
EnumEntry.Description: Recommended State Slave

EnumEntry.Name: RS_Passive
EnumEntry.Description: Recommended State Passive

Enumeration.Name: ptpTransportProtocol
Enumeration.Description: Describes the PTP Transport Protocol used.

EnumEntry.Name: UDP_IPV4
EnumEntry.Description: PTP runs over UDP/IPV4

Integer.Name: timestampModulo
Integer.ToolTip: Specifies the interval between an internal event that is generated base on the Timestamp tick
Integer.Description: Specifies the additional interval between the current Timestamp tick and the event generated. This interval has an 80ns accuracy. Note that the value zero disables the event generator.

Float.Name: timestampModuloFrequency
Float.Description: Returns the frequency of the Timestamp Modulo Event (in Hz).

Integer.Name: timestampModuloStartTime
Integer.ToolTip: Specifies start time of the modulo event
Integer.Description: Specifies the Timestamp value that must be exceeded by the incrementing Timestamp counter before the modulo event starts. This Feature is also used for a "Future" Frame Acquisition.

Integer.Name: timestampModuloActualStartTime
Integer.ToolTip: Reveals the actual start time of the modulo event
Integer.Description: Displays the actual modulo event start time as used by the device. When the user specified “timestampModuloStartTime” is in the future, timestampModuloActualStartTime = timestampModuloStartTime. When the user specified “timestampModuloStartTime” has already past, the camera automatically recalculates a future value for “timestampModuloStartTime” using the user set “timestampModulo” feature value. This new start time is reported by "timestampModuloActualStartTime".

Enumeration.Name: DeviceLinkThroughputLimitMode
Enumeration.ToolTip: Controls if the DeviceLinkThroughputLimit is active
Enumeration.Description: When disabled, lower level TL specific features are expected to control the throughput. When enabled, DeviceLinkThroughputLimit controls the overall throughput.

EnumEntry.Name: Off

EnumEntry.Name: On

Integer.Name: DeviceLinkThroughputLimit

Integer.ToolTip: Select the stream channel to control
Integer.Description: Selects the stream channel to control.

Integer.Name: GevSCPInterfaceIndex
Integer.Description: Index of network interface.

Integer.Name: GevSCPHostPort
Integer.Description: Indicates the port to which the device must send the data stream.

Integer.Name: GevSCPSPacketSize
Integer.Description: Specifies the stream packet size in bytes to send on this channel.

Boolean.Name: GevSCPSDoNotFragment
Boolean.Description: This feature state is copied into the "do not fragment" bit of IP header of each stream packet.

Integer.Name: GevSCPSBigEndianSupported

Boolean.Name: GevSCPSBigEndian

Integer.Name: GevSCPD

Integer.Name: GevSCSP

Boolean.Name: GevGVSPExtendedIDMode
Boolean.Description: Enables the extended ID mode.

Integer.Name: GevLinkSpeed
Integer.Description: Indicates the transmission speed negotiated by the given network interface.

Boolean.Name: GevSupportedIPConfigurationLLA
Boolean.ToolTip: Indicates if LLA mode is supported
Boolean.Description: Indicates if LLA (Auto-IP) is supported by the selected interface. The LLA method automatically assigns the camera with a randomly chosen address on the 169.254.xxx.xxx subnet. After an address is chosen, the link-local process sends an ARP query with that IP onto the network to see if it is already in use. If there is no response, the IP is assigned to the device, otherwise another IP is selected, and the ARP is repeated. Note that LLA is unable to forward packets across routers. LLA is the recommended scheme when only one NIC is connected to GigE cameras; ensure only one NIC is using LLA on your PC, otherwise IP conflicts will result.

Boolean.Name: GevSupportedIPConfigurationDHCP
Boolean.Description: Indicates if DHCP is supported by the selected interface. This IP configuration mode requires a DHCP server to allocate an IP address dynamically over the range of some defined subnet. The camera must be configured to have DHCP enabled. This is the factory default settings. The DHCP server is part of a managed network. Windows itself does not provide a DHCP server function therefore a dedicated DHCP server is required. The DALSA Network Configuration Tool can be configured as a DHCP server on the NIC used for the GigE Vision network.

Boolean.Name: GevSupportedIPConfigurationPersistentIP
Boolean.ToolTip: Indicates if Persistent IP is supported
Boolean.Description: Indicates if Persistent IP is supported by the selected interface. This protocol is only suggested if the user fully controls the assignment of IP addresses on the network and a GigE Vision camera is connected beyond routers. The GigE Vision camera is forced a static IP address. The NIC IP address must use the same subnet otherwise the camera is not accessible. If the camera is connected to a network with a different subnet, it cannot be accessed.

Enumeration.Name: GevSupportedOptionSelector
Enumeration.Description: Selects the GEV option to interrogate for existing support.

Boolean.Name: GevSupportedOption
Boolean.Description: Returns TRUE if the selected GEV option is supported.

Enumeration.Name: GevIPConfigurationStatus
Enumeration.Description: Reports the current IP configuration status.

EnumEntry.Description: Device IP Configuration is not defined.

EnumEntry.Description: Device IP Address Configuration is set to Persistent IP (static).

EnumEntry.Name: DHCP
EnumEntry.Description: Device IP Address Configuration is set to DHCP (Dynamic Host Configuration Protocol). Network requires a DHCP server.

EnumEntry.Name: LLA
EnumEntry.Description: Device IP Address Configuration is set to LLA (Link-Local Address). Also known as Auto-IP. Used for unmanaged networks including direct connections from a device to a dedicated NIC.

EnumEntry.Name: ForceIP
EnumEntry.Description: Device IP Address Configuration is set to ForceIP. Used to force an IP address change.

Enumeration.Name: GevCurrentIPConfiguration
Enumeration.Description: Current camera IP configuration of the selected interface.

EnumEntry.Description: Link-Local Address Mode

EnumEntry.Name: DHCP

EnumEntry.Name: PersistentIP

Integer.Description: Persistent subnet mask for the selected interface.

Integer.ToolTip: Persistent default gateway for the selected interface
Integer.Description: Persistent default gateway for the selected interface.

Integer.Name: GevDiscoveryAckDelay
Integer.Description: Indicates the maximum randomized delay the device will wait to acknowledge a discovery command.

Boolean.Name: GevGVCPExtendedStatusCodes
Boolean.Description: Enables generation of extended status codes.

Integer.Name: GevGVCPPendingTimeout
Integer.Description: Indicates the longest GVCP command execution time before a device returns a PENDING_ACK.

Integer.Name: GevPrimaryApplicationSocket
Integer.Description: Returns the UDP (User Datagram Protocol) source port of the primary application.

Integer.Name: GevPrimaryApplicationIPAddress
Integer.Description: Returns the IP address of the device hosting the primary application.

Integer.Name: GevNumberOfInterfaces
Integer.Description: Indicates the number of physical network interfaces supported by this device.

Enumeration.Name: GevCCP
Enumeration.Description: Controls the device access privilege of an application.

EnumEntry.Name: OpenAccess
EnumEntry.Description: OpenAccess

EnumEntry.Name: ExclusiveAccess
EnumEntry.Description: Grants exclusive access to the device to an application. No other application can control or monitor the device.

EnumEntry.Name: ControlAccess
EnumEntry.Description: Grants control access to the device to an application. No other application can control the device.

EnumEntry.Name: ControlAccessSwitchoverActive
EnumEntry.Description: Enables another application to request control access to the device.

Enumeration.Name: deviceCCP
Enumeration.Description: Controls the device access privilege of an application.

EnumEntry.Name: ExclusiveAccess
EnumEntry.Description: Grants exclusive access to the device to an application. No other application can control or monitor the device.

EnumEntry.Name: ControlAccess
EnumEntry.Description: Grants control access to the device to an application. No other application can control the device.

EnumEntry.Name: ControlAccessSwitchoverActive
EnumEntry.Description: Enables another application to request control access to the device.

Integer.Name: GevInterfaceSelector
Integer.Description: Selects which physical network interface to control.

Integer.Name: GevMessageChannelCount
Integer.Description: Indicates the number of message channels supported by this device.

Integer.Name: GevStreamChannelCount
Integer.Description: Indicates the number of stream channels supported by this device (0 to 512).

Boolean.Name: GevCurrentIPConfigurationLLA
Boolean.Description: Controls whether the LLA (Link Local Address) IP configuration scheme is activated on the given network interface.

Boolean.Name: GevCurrentIPConfigurationDHCP
Boolean.Description: Controls whether the DHCP IP configuration scheme (Dynamic Host Configuration Protocol) is activated on the given network interface.

Boolean.Name: GevCurrentIPConfigurationPersistentIP
Boolean.Description: Controls whether the PersistentIP configuration scheme is activated on the given network interface.

Boolean.Name: GevSCPSFireTestPacket
Boolean.Description: When this feature is set to True, the device will fire one test packet.

Category.Name: GenICamAccess
Category.ToolTip: Persistence feature list

Integer.Name: TLParamsLocked
Integer.ToolTip: Flag to indicate if features are locked during acquisition.
Integer.Description: Flag to indicate if features are locked during acquisition.

Category.Name: FileAccessControl
Category.ToolTip: Category of features related to File access Control for the device

Enumeration.Name: FileSelector
Enumeration.Description: Selects the file to access. The file types which are accessible are device-dependent.

EnumEntry.Name: Firmware1
EnumEntry.Description: Upload new firmware to the camera which will execute on the next camera reboot cycle. Select the DeviceReset feature after the upload completes.

EnumEntry.Name: LutLuminance1
EnumEntry.Description: Select to write (upload) a Look-up-Table file (Sapera .LUT file) into the camera's internal LUT Luminance 1.

EnumEntry.Name: userDefinedSavedImage
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Save an Image in the camera
EnumEntry.Description: Upload and download an image in the camera.

Enumeration.Name: FileOperationSelector
Enumeration.Description: Selects the target operation for the selected file in the device. This operation is executed when the File Operation Execute feature is called.

EnumEntry.Name: Open
EnumEntry.Description: Select the Open operation - executed by FileOperationExecute.

EnumEntry.Name: Close
EnumEntry.Description: Select the Close operation - executed by FileOperationExecute.

EnumEntry.Name: Read
EnumEntry.Description: Select the Read operation - executed by FileOperationExecute

EnumEntry.Name: Write
EnumEntry.Description: Select the Write operation - executed by FileOperationExecute

EnumEntry.Name: Delete
EnumEntry.Description: Select the Delete operation - executed by FileOperationExecute

Command.Name: FileOperationExecute
Command.Description: Executes the operation selected by File Operation Selector on the selected file.

Enumeration.Name: FileOpenMode
Enumeration.Description: Selects the access mode used to open a file on the device.

EnumEntry.Name: Read
EnumEntry.Description: Select read-only open mode

EnumEntry.Name: Write
EnumEntry.Description: Select write-only open mode

Integer.Name: FileAccessOffset
Integer.Description: Controls the mapping offset between the device file storage and the file access buffer.

Integer.Name: FileAccessLength
Integer.Description: Controls the mapping length between the device file storage and the file access buffer.

Enumeration.Name: FileOperationStatus
Enumeration.Description: Displays the file operation execution status.

EnumEntry.Name: Success
EnumEntry.Description: The last file operation has completed successfully.

EnumEntry.Name: Failure
EnumEntry.Description: The last file operation has completed unsuccessfully for an unknown reason.

EnumEntry.Name: FileUnavailable
EnumEntry.Description: The last file operation has completed unsuccessfully because the file is currently unavailable.

EnumEntry.Name: FileInvalid
EnumEntry.ToolTip: The selected file in not present in this camera model
EnumEntry.Description: The last file operation has completed unsuccessfully because the selected file in not present in this camera model.

IntSwissKnife.Name: FileOperationResult
IntSwissKnife.Description: Displays the file operation result. For Read or Write operations, the number of successfully read/written bytes is returned.

Register.Name: FileAccessBuffer
Register.Description: Defines the intermediate access buffer that allows the exchange of data between the device file storage and the application.

IntReg.Name: FileSize
IntReg.Description: Represents the size of the selected file in bytes.

Register.Name: deviceUserBuffer
Register.ToolTip: Unallocated memory available to the user for data storage.
Register.Description: Unallocated memory available to the user for data storage.

Boolean.Name: ftpFileAccessSupported
Boolean.Description: Shows whether File Access is supported over FTP.

Integer.Name: userDefinedSavedImageMaxSize
Integer.ToolTip: Max size of the user Defined Saved Image
Integer.Description: Maximum size of the user Defined Saved Image.
Integer.DisplayName: User Defined Saved Image Max Size

Command.Name: saveLastImageToFlash
Command.ToolTip: Save last acquired image to flash
Command.Description: Command that saves the last acquired image to camera flash memory. Use the file transfer feature to read the image from camera.

Enumeration.Name: transferTurboMode
Enumeration.Description: Set the operation mode of the turbo transfer.

Enumeration.Name: transferTurboCapabilitySelector
Enumeration.Description: Select the host turbo transfer capability to set in the camera.

IntReg.Name: transferTurboCurrentlyAbailable_reg
IntReg.Description: Set the host turbo transfer capability

Boolean.Name: transferTurboCapabilityValue
Boolean.Description: Set the host turbo transfer capability
